objects.title: Wind
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Warm and Wet features. In the Mage's Association, they call it noble probably because there are few number of users.

objects.title: Water
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Cold and Wet features. Both this and Wind are good at liquid manipulation and Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald can make poisonous gas harmless using both of them.

objects.title: Fire
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Warm and Dry features. It is well suited for destructive Magecrafts, symbolizing life and death. The most common element in Mage Association.

objects.title: Earth
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Cold and Dry features. Kiritsugu Emiya applies it to "bind" things that he "severed".

objects.title: Ether
objects.text: Also called the Fifth Imaginary Factor according to the teachings of the Mage’s Association. It combines itself with any of the other four Elements in order to actualize the Mysteries of Thaumaturgy.

objects.title: Hollow
objects.text: Imaginary Element that gives its users access to Imaginary Number Space. Lev Lainur used it as a time capsule and Trisha Fellows put her head into it when killed to keep her killer from using her Mystic Eyes.

objects.title: Dual Affinity
objects.text: Affinity to 2 elements at the same time. Very uncommon among magus. Choose 2 from this list (Except Jack of All Trades).

objects.title: Jack of All Trades
objects.text: High Affinity with all the five great elements. It's incredibly rare and magus with this kind of affinity is highly valued among the mage association.

objects.title: Unique
objects.text: Non-standard element that doesn't fit into the tradition school of thought. It's very rare and overspecialized and therefore may cripple one potential for normal magecraft, but exceptional at doing one specific thing.

objects.title: Nothingness
objects.text: In Magecraft, it is defined as that "which is not possible, but materializes", contrasting Hollow which is defined as that "which is possible but not in the physical plane". It has a different meaning than the "nothing" of physics and math.

objects.title: Reinforcement Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft with the purpose of pushing a basis to the utmost limit. It is the foundation of all Magecraft that enhance the existence of the target by pouring Magical Energy. With the use of this Magecraft, you can enhance the strength and durability of inanimate objects allowing paper to be used as a sword or sword to slice through metal.

objects.title: Enhancement Magecraft
objects.text: Instead of reinforcing inanimate object, It uses the principle of reinforcement to your own body pushing it to the limit that wasn't possible before. Allowing you to survive bullets, jump at massive distances or increase the strength of your punch for a limited time.

objects.title: Curse
objects.text: Practices that one would expect from the traditional (and very clichéd) witches and shamans. Things that fall along the lines of potions, medicines, spirit exorcism and curses that use a material medium (such as a straw doll). They have a strong presence within the Japanese supernatural world. Most of these curses act over time, not immediate, but once it happens they'll have a powerful effect.

objects.title: Magical Crest
objects.text: Allows storage of certain magical spells in a crest which appears as a tattoo on some part of your body. This allows for instantaneous casting which in battle can be a deciding factor.

objects.title: Runes
objects.text: Systems that originated in Scandinavia during the Age of Gods. Composed of only straight lines and possessing mechanics similar to the Magic Crests. Also allows for faster casting however the difference is with runes you trade a little bit of speed for the number of spells you can store.

objects.title: Jewelcraft
objects.text: The Magecraft involving transferring magical energy into jewels to use as limited use Mystic Codes. This allows for creative spells such as making magical grenade or portable shield or just a Mana storage which you can take anytime you want.

objects.title: Familiarcraft
objects.text: Magecraft that specializes on summoning familiars to do your biddings. These familiars are not sentient and appear only for a limited time.

objects.title: Healing Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft that involves recovering the flesh of injured people and of detoxification. Allow you to recover yourself or your servant mid-battle. A very useful Magecraft for a master since the servant gonna do most of the fighting anyway.

objects.title: Golemancy
objects.text: The practice of creating golems. Unlike Familiars, these golems are partially sentient and capable of doing action after being given a general order. However, unlike Familiar, you'll need extensive preparation and ritual to create each of these golems.

objects.title: Shapeshifting
objects.text: The Magecraft which allows the user to take the form of another, be it animal, beast, or another human. During this transformation the user gets the physiology of the being, allowing the use of claws, teeth and the sort.

objects.title: Illusion Magecraft
objects.text: The Magecraft that allows the user to create Illusions, a projection of things that weren't actually there. These Illusions are just images so they wouldn't have any physical properties.

objects.title: Astromancy
objects.text: A form of Magecraft that are weak during the modern age but extremely powerful during the Age of Gods. This magecaft hinges on the mystery contained within stars and other astronomical bodies. On extreme cases these allows the user to generate and manipulate these energies in a form that they wished, be it creating weapons or creating barrages of light to strike their opponents.

objects.title: Projection Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft with purpose to shape magical energy into the material composition and design of an object that is being imagined by the magus. The item is not everlasting, as it is recognized by the world as a phantasm that doesn't belong in the natural world, and it will be erased as an inconsistency. The better the image in the caster's imagination, the more stable and longer lasting the object will be.

objects.title: Imaginary Number
objects.text: A special type of magecraft. A forbidden spell that lays the subconscius bare and turns its negative side into a blade. A power highly effective against spiritual beings, but not so potent against those whose body is not made out of Ether. When the Matou clan restraining spells are used along with this, it is possible to imprison and skewer the target into a separate dimension composed entirely of shadows.

objects.title: Spatial Transportation
objects.text: Magecraft that allows the user to create a gateway that connects to another point in space (Portals). The Portal generated are very limited in it's distance. It is nearly impossible to accomplish Spatial Transportation in the present, though within the lostbelt it might be possible due to the different amount of mystery.

objects.title: Probability Magecraft
objects.text: A powerful form of Magecraft that affects Destiny itself. This Magecraft allows the user to sway destiny to a more favourable outcome. Some would say performing miracles. However, most of the time the user wouldn't have any control over this power. It's pure chaos.

objects.title: Time Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft that allows the user to slow down time or even stop it completely.  It allows for "time adjustment" that can only stagnate the time which has passed and accelerate time in the future rather than something more advanced like "time modification". In short, you can't rewind time.

objects.title: Necromancy
objects.text: A Magecraft born through the manipulation of corpses. Allows feats like raising simple zombies or giving birth to cobbled monsters. Those most proficient in their craft are said to have a fate of taking the greatest joys in gathering resources from the wakes of revolutions, coup d'etats, or any massive destruction resulting in genocide

objects.title: Reality Marble
objects.text: Magecraft that allows materialization and projection of one's inner world onto reality. The created worlds are completely cut off from normal reality, projecting their internal landscape and sealing off the regular World. Reality Marbles represent the pinnacle of all Bounded Fields where the boundary line becomes the space itself.

objects.title: Strength
objects.text: Your strength got increased to the level of a peak human. Allowing you to punch with high force and lift heavy stuff.

objects.title: Agility
objects.text: Your agility got increased to the level of a peak human. Increase both your speed and reaction time.

objects.title: Fit
objects.text: Your stamina got increased to the level of a peak human. Allow you to do taxing stuff for a long time.

objects.title: Luck
objects.text: Skill that represents a character's good fortune and ability to influence outcome through chance and probability.

objects.title: Martial Arts
objects.text: The ability to use various hand-to-hand combat techniques and strategies in a particular martial art form, as well as develop physical strength, endurance, and agility through consistent training.

objects.title: Swordmaster
objects.text: The ability to handle a sword with precision and control, as well as the ability to execute various sword techniques and strategies with speed and accuracy.

objects.title: Marksman
objects.text: The ability to shoot a firearm accurately and consistently, as well as the ability to execute various shooting techniques and strategies with precision. Includes the ability to adapt to different environments.

objects.title: Weapon Mastery
objects.text: Skill that represents a character's proficiency and familiarity with multiple types of weapons.

objects.title: Strategic Mind
objects.text: Skill that represents a character's ability to think critically and plan ahead. It can be used to analyze a situation, identify strengths and weaknesses, and come up with a plan of action.

objects.title: Charisma
objects.text: A skill that represents a character's force of personality, persuasiveness, and charm. It can be used to influence the actions of others, whether through negotiation, persuasion, or intimidation.

objects.title: Natural Leader
objects.text: A skill that represents a character's ability to inspire and lead others. It can be used to boost the morale and performance of allies, and to coordinate their actions in battle.

objects.title: Riding
objects.text: A skill that represents a character's ability to operate and control various types of vehicles, such as cars, motorcycles, or various kind of animals and even demon beast.

objects.title: Stealth
objects.text: A skill that represents a character's ability to move quietly and remain hidden from view. With this skill, a character may be able to move silently and blend into their surroundings.

objects.title: Manipulation
objects.text: A skill that represents a character's ability to influence the thoughts and actions of others through deception, persuasion, and misdirection.

objects.title: Frail
objects.text: Your body is frail and incapable of performing even basic physical tasks. You are entirely dependent on your Servant for protection, mobility, and survival. Without them, you are vulnerable to even the weakest of enemies.

objects.title: Slow
objects.text: Your agility is severely reduced, making you an easy target for enemies. Your reaction times are slower, and your movement speed is sluggish, putting you at a disadvantage in combat and during critical moments of escape.

objects.title: Unfit
objects.text: Your stamina and endurance are below average. Running or performing strenuous actions quickly exhausts you, and you can only maintain battle-ready focus for short durations. Long-term engagements become nearly impossible to manage.

objects.title: Bad Luck
objects.text: Fortune never seems to favor you. Critical failures occur at the worst moments, enemies target you over others, and plans often go awry for reasons beyond your control.

objects.title: Alluring Scent
objects.text: You emanate a scent that attracts Demonic Beasts and monstrous creatures, drawing them to you like a beacon. They target you first in battles, and their hostility toward you is heightened. Outside of combat, hiding from them becomes a near-impossible task.

objects.title: Broken Circuit
objects.text: Your magic circuits are in shambles, barely functional. Due to your broken magical circuit, you're only able to cast magecraft for only 5 times. This didn't affect your summoning capabilities.

objects.title: Magically Inept
objects.text: You lack the ability to use magecraft entirely. While you can still summon a Servant, you cannot directly channel mana to them. Your Servant wont be able to turn into spirit form and you'll have to find other means to transfer mana.

objects.title: Cursed Wound
objects.text: A lingering curse afflicts you, sapping your strength and occasionally flaring up to disrupt your actions. Healing only temporarily suppresses the curse, and it leaves you vulnerable at critical moments.

objects.title: Lingering Phantom
objects.text: You are haunted by the spiritual remnants of an unknown entity. They interfere with your decisions, occasionally influencing your actions drifting them to a purpose that only the entity would know.

objects.title: Naive Idealist
objects.text: You believe in the inherent goodness of people and struggle to accept the darker sides of human nature. You may trust untrustworthy individuals, or fail to see the hidden malice in your enemies' actions. This mindset often leads to betrayal or missed opportunities.

objects.title: Hero of Justice
objects.text: Despite being in a group that massacred humanity, You are burdened with an unwavering desire to save everyone you meet, regardless of the risks or consequences. You will find it difficult to make pragmatic decisions, especially when sacrifices are necessary to achieve your mission.

objects.title: Arrogant
objects.text: You believe in your abilities far more than reality justifies. You are prone to overestimating your skills and underestimating the dangers you face, often placing yourself and your allies in unnecessary peril.

objects.title: Fearful
objects.text: You are prone to panic and fear in stressful or dangerous situations. This limits your ability to think clearly during combat or high-stakes negotiations. Your fearfulness may also unsettle or frustrate your Servant or other allies.

objects.title: Coward
objects.text: You are deeply afraid of conflict and danger, often trying to avoid confrontation altogether. This can lead to abandoning allies or failing to act when it matters most, earning you the disdain of your peers.

objects.title: Overprotective
objects.text: Your bond with your Servant is so strong that you prioritize their safety above all else. You may hesitate to use them effectively in battle, and your attachment might lead to conflicts if they desire more freedom or glory.

objects.title: Impulsive
objects.text: You have no regard for personal safety or long-term consequences, often rushing headfirst into danger without considering alternatives. This behavior frequently puts you and your allies at risk, forcing others to clean up your mess.

objects.title: Stupid
objects.text: Your intellectual capabilities leave much to be desired. You struggle with problem-solving or understanding complex situations. Your decisions are often poorly thought out, leading to unnecessary complications or outright disaster.

objects.title: Obsessive
objects.text: You become fixated on a single goal, idea, or person, often to the detriment of your relationships. This tunnel vision prevents you from seeing the bigger picture or adapting to changing circumstances.

objects.title: Technologically Inept
objects.text: You are hopelessly bad with technology, struggling with even basic tools. Any device requiring technical knowledge is a mystery to you, forcing you to rely on others for tasks involving modern equipment.

objects.title: Cardboard
objects.text: Your presence is so ordinary and uninteresting that even allies tend to overlook or dismiss you. This makes it harder to inspire confidence, rally support, or be taken seriously in critical moments.

objects.title: Sadistic
objects.text: You take pleasure in the suffering of others, whether they are enemies or allies. This twisted mindset alienates those around you and fosters distrust and resentment. Some parties may also become more determined to stop you after witnessing your cruel tendencies.

objects.title: Masochist
objects.text: You derive satisfaction from your own suffering, often putting yourself in harm's way unnecessarily. This self-destructive behavior often frustrates your allies, as they are forced to expend valuable resources and energy to protect you. Your willingness to endure pain can also lead to recklessness in battle or negotiations.

objects.title: Split Personality
objects.text: You have a fragmented mind, with a secondary personality emerging in stressful situations. This alternate persona often has goals and beliefs that conflict with your own, causing chaos in your decision-making and relationships.

objects.title: Phobia
objects.text: You have an intense, irrational fear of something—such as darkness, fire, or certain creatures—that renders you unable to function in its presence. Your enemies may exploit this weakness to gain the upper hand.

objects.title: Addiction
objects.text: You are addicted to a substance or activity that impairs your focus and judgment. Whether it’s a drug or a magical item, you won't be able to function properly without them. Also you might find some difficulty finding those items in the new world depending on the type of your Lostbelt.

objects.title: NFF Service
objects.text:
Hello, I'm Tamamo Vitch Koyanskaya the proud CEO of the Nine Fox Foundation or NFF Service for short. Would you like to use our service? And before you ask, No, I'm not related to that Tamamo

Unlocks NFF Service

objects.title: NFF - Travel
objects.text: Normally once you've spawned in your Lostbelt you can no longer get out. However, we at NFF Service have some ways to bypass that. By purchasing our service you can get out of your Lostbelt and visit another anytime you want.

objects.title: NFF - Weaponry
objects.text:
You can't get anywhere with only magecraft right? Fortunately, we at NFF Service pride ourselves on our assortance of armaments gathered from various parts of the multiverse. 

Unlocks crossover weapon choice

objects.title: NFF - Demon Beast
objects.text: We at NFF also have our assortment of different Demon Beasts at our disposal. This Subscription allows you to purchase various Demon Beast armies under your control. Get a 50% discount now on the purchase of Lahmu, Jotunn and Kali.

objects.title: NFF - Demon Beast II
objects.text: With these Subscriptions, not only you're allowed to purchase our various Demon Beast. You are also allowed to try several experimental ones, including Ivan The Terrible Mamooth form from Russian Lostbelt and Surtr from Scandinavian Lostbelt.

objects.title: NFF - Base
objects.text: Regardless of the situation of your Lostbelt, we will establish a secret base for your operation. This Base will be filled with an army of 100 machine dolls with basic weaponry. They won't help you outside of your base but will keep anyone from entering. This Base can also be used to store Demon Beast or Weapon you purchased.

objects.title: Beast of Cherisment
objects.text: Since you are such a valuable customer, with a price, I can have one of my tails stand by at your command. Like all my other copies they can also turn into my beast form. I'm not yet a fully-fledged Beast like Goetia or The Alien God but I'm still very powerful you know.

objects.title: Katana Sword
objects.text:
A Simple Melee weapon with no enchantment or legend. It's honestly pretty useless if you already learn any offensive Magecraft. It won't be able to hurt being with enhanced skin and you'll need to get close to using it. 

You'll probably only use this when you're out of mana. However, it's generally better to just hide and wait for your mana to recharge.

objects.title: Glock 17
objects.text:
A short recoil-operated, locked-breech semi-automatic pistol that was adapted from the Hi-Power pistol. Usually, a weapon used by law enforcement.

Better than a simple sword considering you'll have a ranged attack. It is still useless against anyone with enhanced durability but you can use this for a quick attack if your Magecraft needs some time to cast. The downside is you'll need some Ammo to use it.

objects.title: M16 Carbine
objects.text:
A lightweight, 5.56 mm, air-cooled, gas-operated, magazine-fed assault rifle, with a rotating bolt. Allows continuous firing and long-range combat.

Not only faster than a Glock, but this assault rifle also packs much more force allowing you to damage beings with medium durability given you use it enough times. Similar to a glock you'll need an ammo to use it.

objects.title: Kanshou & Bakuya
objects.text: Twin swords crafted by the blacksmith Gān Jiàng during the Spring and Autumn Period of China. These swords have a strong affinity against monsters, allowing them to easily cut down creatures like the Gorgon. The main ability of the swords is their strong bond with each other, which not only allows them to attract each other, but it is also said they will return to their owner even if events cause them to be lost.

objects.title: Tank
objects.text:
An armoured fighting vehicle intended as a primary offensive weapon in front-line ground combat. Tank designs are a balance of heavy firepower, strong armor, and good battlefield mobility provided by tracks and a powerful engine. 

A powerful tool if you wanted to have massive firepower without using magecraft. However, it still would be outclassed by most Noble Phantasm. Plus you'll need a place to store this thing.

objects.title: Caliburn
objects.text: The Weapon of King Arthur before the famous Excalibur.  It looks similar to Excalibur, which she later received from the Lady of the Lake, but it is a different sword and has different Noble Phantasm characteristics. It is generally inferior to Excalibur, however, it is still a very strong sword and has divine properties.

objects.title: Rule Breaker
objects.text:
A weapon that materializes and embodies the Divinity of the Witch of Betrayal. Its effectively nonexistent in its capacity as a weapon and wouldn't be suitable for even killing a single person. 

Its main ability is to nullifies all effects created by magecraft despite whether such an effect is an enchantment, a relationship formed through contact, or even life created through magical energy

objects.title: Jewelled Sword of Zeltrech
objects.text:
This is a Mystic Code designed and created by Zelretch, a magician known and feared as the "Kaleidoscope."

Its true form is not a sword, but a staff. Although limited, it can draw out magical energy leaked from parallel worlds, making the Second Magic a reality and creating slashes of light from concentrated energy.

objects.title: Neuralyzer
objects.text:
A device varying in size, that wipes the memory of a target. The set length of memory erased can be changed using dials, and the effects can be reversed. To not be harmed by the effects, this purchase includes a "Ray-Ban" sunglasses, that deflect the light created by the neuralyzer. 

Koyanskaya Note: This device is very useful for stealth missions or to neutralize enemies without needing to kill them. Or probably for some other more pleasurable uses.

objects.title: Samehada
objects.text:
A sentient weapon that gains nourishment from the chakra of others. It has a mind of its own and is at its happiest when engorged with chakra that possesses both a distinctive and pleasant flavour. It can also give mana to the wielder should it choose to.

Koyanskaya Note: Chakra is apparently similar to Magical Energy. It is useful to drain power from other mages and since it's sentient there's no need to traditionally wield it. Oh, and it bites.

objects.title: Lightsaber
objects.text:
A blade made of pure hot plasma capable of cutting through any material. It draws power from a substance known as Kyber Crystal which stored in its handheld and held nigh unlimited energy. It came in various colors, blue, green, red, and purple 

Koyanskaya Note: The Force not included

objects.title: Yatsufusa
objects.text:
A long katana with the power to reanimate and control corpses. Any living enemy, no matter how strong, if killed by this sword can be brought back as a puppet. It doesn't matter the actual damage dealt as long as it deals the killing blow.  The maximum amount you can store is up to 6. 

The problem is that this sword material is just normal metal and prone to breaking, maybe there's something you can do to increase its durability?

Koyankskaya Note: A must-have tool for Necromancers. And an extremely good prop for Halloween.

objects.title: Portal Gun
objects.text: An experimental tool used to create two portals through which objects can pass.  When the device is fired, a burst of energy will be released from the end of the device. If the projectile strikes a valid surface, a portal of the corresponding color will be formed. If a portal of the other color is already placed, these two portals will be linked. If a portal of the same color is already placed, it will be closed and the new one will be used instead.

objects.title: TIE Interceptor
objects.text:
A Special model of The Signature Starfighter of the Galactic Empire featuring four very recognizable pointed solar panels. Lacking both shields and a hyperdrive, it made up for its lack of defensive capabilities with a top speed of 1,250 kph. In addition, four laser cannons on its wingtips allowed for far more firepower to overload the shields on an enemy craft.

Koyankskaya Note: The original TIE Fighter got so many complaints so we end up capturing another better model.

objects.title: 4 Dimensional Pocket
objects.text:
The 4D pocket acts as a portal that allows the user to access and deposit items in another dimension with little concern of space occupation or mass. It also has the ability to shrink or enlarge objects, such as they can be easily stored when needed while not impacting their abilities, as shrunken objects are restored to their normal sizes when they exit.

Koyanskaya Note: Gadgets sold separately.

objects.title: Bat Mobile
objects.text: A heavily armoured tactical assault vehicle and a personalized custom-built pursuit and capture vehicle that is used by a vigilante known as Batman in his crime-fighting escapades. Despite its looks, this vehicle feature both massively larger firepower and durability than a tank.

objects.title: War Machine Mark I
objects.text:
A Marvelous piece of engineering. This human-sized armour mounts a massive amount of firepower capable to level an entire city. In addition, it's also capable of flight with a maximum speed reaching Mach 2. 

It is powered by a miniaturized nuclear reactor placed on its chest. It originally features artificial intelligence that serves as a guide on operating the suit. However, due to damages when acquired, it currently only features a HUD system and automatic targeting.

Koyanksaya Note:  Wait what? This is an inferior model!?

objects.title: Gundam
objects.text: An advanced, high-performance piece of machinery. It is massive in size, about 18 Meters tall. It is equipped with powerful beam weapons and are typically armored in a special alloy. It can be used in both land and space battlefields and sure to dominate it.

rows.title: Residence
rows.titleText: Where do you stay in your Lostbelt.

rows.title: Mythology - Age of Gods
rows.titleText: Which Mythology do your Lostbelt based on

rows.title: Lostbelt King - Age of Gods
rows.titleText:
Once your Lostbelt is stable, The Fantasy Tree will bound themselves to a powerful individual in the Lostbelt known as The Lostbelt King. Most Blessing and Power increase will go to them until the Lostbelt becomes the true history.

Who is the Losbelt King? It Must not be the same with your own servant

objects.title: Odin
objects.text:
Odin managed to seal Surtur before he killed enough gods to cripple Asgard. However, due to his attack, Asgard is now destroyed and Earth is broken beyond all belief. Giants from Jotunheim roam the surface and the human race unable to survive by themselves. 

With his authority, Odin establishes a safe haven for humanity. Today, the Lostbelt is a thriving empire. Odin already managed to make the entire world habitable again and soon will take it upon himself to build colonies in outer space. In its centre is the capital city of Asgard, a reminder for the Norse gods of the Homeworld they lost. 

Not far from Asgard was the King of Fire Giants, Surtur still sealed within the False Sun, and used as an energy source. Though time will tell if he will once again be unleashed upon the world.

objects.title: Scathach-Skadi
objects.text:
Odin uses the remaining essence of Asgardians to seal Surtur in a false sun. Before dying, Odin then merged the goddess Skadi with Scáthach, creating Scáthach-Skadi, with the purpose of protecting the humans. Ragnarok was thus interrupted, the Earth became ravaged by fire and ice, unable to continue past Ragnarok. 

Skadi established multiple villages for humans, with the support of the Valkyrie. However, in order to keep the giants at bay, humans are required to reproduce at the age of fifteen or be sacrificed to the giants. Once humans reach the age of twenty-five they are nonetheless forced to be sacrificed.

objects.title: Loki
objects.text:
Odin failed to seal Surtr and was only able to weaken him. Loki made a deal with Hela, the goddess of death. Against all odds and with the help of Hel, Asgard manages to kill Surtr and his giants but not without heavy casualties. In the end, there are only 3 Gods left, Loki, Skadi and Hela. 

Skadi and Loki brought it on themselves to protect what remains of humanity. However, per the deal with Hela, half of Earth is now under her authority, a wasteland filled with undead and demons. In addition to that, The God of Mischief seems to be hiding something even worse. Maybe Hela isn't the only being he made deal with.

(Pick White Titan)

objects.title: Zeus
objects.text:
Several thousand years before the present, a civil war known as the Olympiamachia was triggered over a disagreement about whether to continue the Age of Gods with their absolute rule over the humans or to co-exist alongside them on a closer level. Zeus was originally alone but used his power to subjugate Demeter, Aphrodite, Hera, and Artemis. This conflict ended in the victory of Zeus.

The human residents are divided into those outsides and those inside Olympus. Both possess an extremely long lifespan but those inside Olympus are granted pseudo-immortality through Demeter's Authority, not ageing and unable to die. Not needing to work and with no disputes over resources. The majority of the populace are loyal to the gods. However, they would not be able to survive if Zeus carried out his secret plan of converting Olympus into a space colony and departing Earth.

objects.title: Hades
objects.text:
Instead of Zeus, the Co-existence Faction consisting of Hephaestus, Hades, Athena, Apollo, Hestia, and Ares won the Olympiamachia. Zeus was imprisoned, his authority stripped away and the subjugated gods were freed from his influence. Hades was put as the leader of Olympus. The Gods alliance then execute the coexistence plan. Instead of being restricted to Olympus, they started to distribute their advanced technology to the human world allowing them to thrive by themselves instead of being dependent on their gods.

The humans living on this Lostbelt all possess an extremely long lifespan. Most of them live until 10,000 years old. Their physical body age normally until 18 years old, when it slows down absurdly to the point that they only age 1 day per year. The Olympians were still regarded as Gods but they function in society similar to superheroes. You can see them once in a while, bringing prosperity to various parts of the world.

objects.title: Arjuna Alter
objects.text:
During the climax of the Mahabharata, Arjuna absorbed all of the Hindu Gods starting with Krishna. He became Arjuna Alter, a living god with a skewed personality, and decided a perfect being like himself must live in a perfect world befitting him. Originally the Yuga System in Hindu Mythology that destroys and recreates the World occurs after several millennia, however, Arjuna Alter's impatience changed it to occur on a weekly basis. While doing this, any person with the tiniest bit of evil, or considered "evil" by Arjuna Alter would be killed without exception. Those people cannot reincarnate and will be forever forgotten. 

Arjuna Alter's Yuga System isn't a complete restart, instead, elements deemed imperfect are slowly removed. To live in this world and be considered good, a person must pray to Arjuna Alter every day, obey his word, and abandon all weapons and conflict. If a person is deemed a failure, they're considered evil, and thus holy beasts and Kali will come to start a new cycle to remove said "evil". Arjuna Alter wants to create the perfect world and then extend it to the entire galaxy.

objects.title: Kama
objects.text:
The true nature of this Lostbelt and how it came to be is a mystery. However, this Lostbelt was presumed to be a pocket dimension made reality. This dimension is completely under the control of one being, Kama, the Indian God of Love.

On the surface, this Lostbelt was a Utopia, a land without conflict. However, this is only possible because Kama had a powerful mental influence over all of its inhabitants. The inhabitants of this Lostbelt no longer care about money and power because they don't have any pride, greed, wrath, or envy. All they have are lust and depravity. 

Due to Kama influence, this Lostbelt seems to have a corrupting effect on any human entering it. Be very careful with your mental state.

objects.title: Gilgamesh
objects.text:
Unlike in Proper Human History, in this Lostbelt The King of Heroes never went on his heart-changing journey to the underworld. This left him an unbearably arrogant king with extreme hatred for Gods. A few years after Enkidu's death caused by Ishtar, he wages a large-scale war against the Mesopotamian Gods. 

Due to the Mesopotamian Gods already weakening authority and Gilgamesh's superior strategy, he was able to come up on top. He even manages to strip some of their authority and store them as his treasure. One of those authorities allows him to achieve true immortality. 

Eventually, Gilgamesh also waged war against deities from other civilizations, from Egypt to Norse, every battle strengthen his authority and makes him stronger. To the present day, he went unchallenged as the only king in a world without heroes.

objects.title: Ishtar
objects.text:
Gilgamesh lost the war against the Mesopotamian Gods. He was then put on trial by the deities and killed as a result. Soon after his defeat, Ishtar requested to be given Gilgamesh's treasure and kingdom which got accepted. 

However, even Gilgamesh's massive treasure isn't enough for her greed and she demands more of human territory. To their horror, she eventually manages to conquer other human civilizations. When other Gods' authority grows weaker, hers keeps getting stronger as she gains more and more worshippers.

To this day she went unchallenged. The human living in her Lostbelt worships her and only her as their ruler, saviour and god.

objects.title: Tiamat
objects.text:
The Collapse of Human Order in the present had a domino effect on the past. A primordial being, Tiamat has returned to the world, now without anyone to challenge her. 

No human beings are still left alive in this Lostbelt. Well, none would've been better. Instead, They have been turned into monstrous beings known as Lahmu, the new human. Due to how long they have been alive, The Lahmu have evolved multiple times. They are leagues stronger than the Lahmu Chaldea encounter in the seventh singularity. At the core of this is the primordial goddess herself, Beast II, Tiamat who had been non-stop mourning since thousands of years ago.

This Lostbelt is pure nightmare, I don't know why anyone wants to go here, especially if they are human.

objects.title: Someone Else
objects.text: Choose some other Heroic Spirit to be The Lostbelt King (In the next Lostbelt King Section). Note that Lostbelt King in the Age of Gods will have some level of divine authority. This Heroic Spirit you chose will either be someone granted/stole that authority from any chosen god of yours or an Avatar of them. You also can determine what kind of situation makes them get their power and what kind of world they up making.

rows.title: Lostbelt King - Alternate History
rows.titleText:
Once your Lostbelt is stable, The Fantasy Tree will bound themselves to a powerful individual in the Lostbelt known as The Lostbelt King. Most Blessing and Power increase will go to them until the Lostbelt becomes the true history.

Who is the Losbelt King? It Must not be the same with your own servant

objects.title: Qin Shi Huang
objects.text:
The Lostbelt diverged from the Proper Human History in 210 BC, during the end of the reign of Qin Shi Huang. Qin Shi Huang, during his search for an elixir of life, discovered the artificial body of Nezha, which he used to develop technology that allowed him to continue existing in an artificial form. This method allowed Qin Shi Huang to continue ruling China forever. 

Due to his “immortality” and technological equipment, he eventually managed to conquer the whole world after years of wars, dubbing this new empire as the Eternal Sin Empire.

After his conquest was completed, Qin Shi Huang created a planetary defense system that surrounded the whole Earth, called the “Great Wall”, which allowed him to monitor everything in the world. 

Despite the advanced technology in his control, the common folk were kept uneducated, with no access to this technology. Thus, the society of the empire remains at a basic farming level. However, the people live in complete peace, with no conflicts occurring over hundreds of years.

objects.title: Ivan The Terrible
objects.text:
The Lostbelt diverged from the Proper Human History in 1570 AD when an asteroid struck and plunged the world into an ice age. 

Most humans died, and while Russians were used to the cold and prepared for such weather, 90% of their population perished and they were on the cusp of extinction. 

Ivan the Terrible and his mages were able to save the country by combining humans with magical beasts, creating the Yaga, with Ivan himself becoming the first. 

An Eternal Winter rages endlessly in this Losbelt which renders humanity all but extinct (still alive but as Yaga). Aside from the Yagas, this Lostbelt is also home to many Demon Beasts. Like the humans, Ordinary animals that once roam the planet have all died away due to the temperature. 

This Lostbelt is an extremely harsh world where the strong barely survive while the weak wither away.

objects.title: Vlad The Impaler
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt stems from the 15th century, during the rule of Vlad III, the Voivode of Wallachia, known as Vlad the Impaler. In this Lostbelt, Vlad unearthed an ancient, forbidden power buried deep beneath the Carpathian Mountains. By merging with this dark force, Vlad became an immortal ruler, a vampiric overlord whose strength and charisma turned the tide of history, a power which allow him to drive out the Ottomans.

This world is one of eternal night, where the sun has been banished by Vlad’s will. Under his rule, the lands of Eastern Europe expanded into a sprawling, gothic empire shrouded in darkness. Known as "Noapte Eternă" (The Eternal Night), his kingdom is a realm of shadow and fear, where towering castles loom over misty valleys, and crimson rivers wind through forests of withered trees.

The people of this Lostbelt live under a strict and hierarchical system. Those who prove their loyalty and usefulness are granted the privilege of serving Vlad directly, often rewarded with the gift of vampirism. The rest of humanity toils in servitude, providing sustenance for their vampiric overlords in exchange for protection from the horrors that lurk in the dark.

objects.title: Jeanne D'arc (False)
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt originates in 1431, at the moment of Jeanne d’Arc’s execution. In Proper Human History, Jeanne perished in the flames, her faith unbroken as the fire consumed her. But in this Lostbelt, she wore a necklace gifted by a villager during one of her campaign. Unknown to her, the necklace was no mere necklace but rather a relic of cosmic origin, an angel artifact. 

As she stood upon the pyre, clutching the relic in prayer, it activated as if a response to her unshaken faith. Jeanne died, consumed not by fire but by the overwhelming light of the relic, which reconstituted her as a Terminal of the Dark Star—an immortal, unaging vessel of otherworldly power.

The real Jeanne d’Arc died that day, but the Terminal created in her image retained her memories, personality, and conviction, believing the cold, repetitive directive in her head to be the voice of God. As a Terminal, Jeanne became indestructible, with strength far surpassing mortal limits and the ability to summon radiant beings whose power eclipsed even Heroic Spirits. These celestial entities obliterated entire armies, and their presence turned the tide of the Hundred Years’ War.

Convinced of her divine mission, Jeanne unified France and extended her dominion across Europe. Kingdoms surrendered without resistance, awed by her immortality and the miracles of her "angels." Yet beneath this enforced peace, humanity stagnated. Innovation and ambition were silenced, suppressed by the unseen will of the relic.

This Lostbelt’s world is tranquil yet suffocating, ruled by the Terminal of Jeanne d’Arc, who unknowingly enforces a cosmic decree. Adored as a saint and savior, she guides humanity into timeless stasis, trading its future for the illusion of divine salvation.

objects.title: Napoleon Bonaparte
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt originates in 1812, during Napoleon Bonaparte’s invasion of Russia.In Proper Human History, the brutal Russian winter and supply shortages forced the French emperor to retreat, marking the beginning of his decline. 

But in this Lostbelt, history took a decisive turn. With an unyielding charisma and supernatural inspiration, Napoleon rallied his troops, overcame the Russian winter, and successfully conquered Moscow. 

This monumental victory shattered the balance of power in Europe, allowing him to unite the continent under his rule and establish an empire that endured for centuries.

As time passed, Napoleon’s ambition transcended mortal limits. Harnessing his immense willpower and the loyalty of his people, he discovered the means to ascend to a godlike existence. 

Whether through a pact with an unknown entity or sheer force of determination, Napoleon gained the ability to reshape the world according to his ideals. In this Lostbelt, the Emperor of the French became the Emperor of Humanity, a ruler whose vision encompassed not only Europe but the entire planet.

Napoleon’s world is one of grandeur and order, built upon the principles of discipline, unity, and progress. Cities are sprawling metropolises of marble and steel, adorned with triumphal arches, statues, and monuments glorifying the Emperor and his conquests. 

The ideals of liberty and democracy, which Napoleon once championed, have been twisted into tools of control, ensuring the eternal stability of his empire.

objects.title: The Führer
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt lies in 1941, during the critical events of World War II. In this timeline, Operation Barbarossa—the German invasion of the Soviet Union—did not falter. 

Through an inexplicable twist of fate or the intervention of a mysterious power, the German Wehrmacht triumphed, conquering the vast expanse of the USSR and securing an unshakable stronghold over Europe. With the Allied forces crushed and resistance snuffed out, the Third Reich rose to absolute global dominance, transforming the world into a chilling vision of authoritarian order.

The Lostbelt King, known only as “The Führer,” presides over this grim reality. Whether this Führer is still Adolf Hitler, a successor, or something far more sinister is a mystery even to the empire’s highest echelons. The Führer has erased all personal details, existing only as an omnipresent symbol of the regime's authority. 

His face is never seen, his voice rarely heard, but his will is absolute, conveyed through a network of loyal enforcers and propaganda that binds the world in submission. He is more idea than man.

The people of this world live under a rigid hierarchy. The Übermenschen (Overmen) sit at the top, a genetically engineered elite cultivated to embody the ideals of the regime. Below them are the citizens, strictly monitored and conditioned to serve the state with unwavering loyalty. 

Those deemed unfit—the weak, the dissenters, and those of "impure lineage"—are consigned to perpetual servitude or cast out into the desolate regions beyond the Reich's control, where survival is nearly impossible.

objects.title: Nikola Tesla
objects.text:
In this Lostbelt, Nikola Tesla’s revolutionary discoveries and theories about wireless energy transmission and free energy not only came to fruition but also dramatically transformed the technological landscape by the late 19th century. 

Tesla, obsessed with creating a perfectly efficient, technology-driven utopia, managed to harness the boundless powers of natural and cosmic energies, gaining unparalleled dominance over the world’s energy supplies.

Tesla’s utopia, is an expanse of radiant cities and towering structures reaching into the skies, all powered by renewable energies. His rule, though seemingly benevolent, is tyrannically absolute, enforcing peace through an omnipresent control over electricity that can pacify or obliterate dissent in an instant. 

Tesla’s monopoly over energy has rendered the population utterly dependent on his power systems for every facet of life, including basic human necessities. This dependency is so profound that Tesla could extinguish life on a massive scale by simply cutting off the power supply, making rebellion virtually impossible and the populace excessively compliant.

objects.title: Thomas Alva Edison
objects.text:
In this Lostbelt, Thomas Edison succeeded in completely eliminating his rivals, including Nikola Tesla, using ruthless business tactics and extensive political influence. This allowed Edison to establish a monopoly over all technological advancements and set the foundations for an autocratic regime ruled by his massive corporate empire.

Edison's control over electricity and all emerging technologies led to a society where his corporation, Edison Electric, became the central governing body. Every aspect of life is commodified, from electricity to information, all strictly controlled and distributed by the corporation. The population is segmented into classes based solely on their economic contribution and usefulness to Edison Electric.

Edison’s governance is efficient but oppressively utilitarian, treating individuals as assets or liabilities rather than as people. Freedom of thought and innovation are curtailed, with Edison's corporate police enforcing compliance and punishing any form of dissent. Intellectual property laws are draconian, and any unauthorized attempts at innovation are met with severe penalties.

objects.title: Sessyoin Kiara
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt traces back to a pivotal moment in the late 20th century, where the enigmatic Sessyoin Kiara's cult of devotion and excess reached its zenith. In Proper Human History, her cult's practices of unbridled hedonism and the exploitation of her followers drew the wrath of the Counter Force, manifesting as Emiya Alter, who swiftly annihilated the sect before its influence could spiral further. However, in this Lostbelt, the Counter Force failed to act, allowing Kiara’s teachings and practices to flourish unchecked.

With no one to oppose her, Kiara’s doctrine spread like wildfire, her charisma and spiritual allure drawing countless souls into her fold. Under her leadership, humanity abandoned traditional moral frameworks and societal structures, replacing them with a universal creed centered on transcendence through sensual enlightenment. Kiara’s cult grew into a global empire, where indulgence in bodily pleasures and spiritual ecstasy became the ultimate pursuit. 

In this world, the concepts of individuality and free will dissolved under Kiara’s teachings. Her followers, entranced by her divine aura and promises of eternal fulfillment, became vessels of her will. Their devotion empowered her beyond mortal limitations, elevating her to a status akin to a living god. Cities became grand temples of worship, adorned with golden spires and ethereal gardens where adherents participated in endless rituals to honor their "Bodhisattva of Lust."

objects.title: Angra Mainyu
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt traces back to 1994 AD in Fuyuki City, where a catastrophic event occurs s a result of a Holy Grail War. Due to the grail corruption caused by an Avenger class servant, this Holy Grail War results in something horrifying. 

Emerging as the Beast of Retribution, the previously mentioned Avenger class servant unleashes a deadly phenomenon resembling Tiamat's primordial mud that Chaldea encountered on the 7th Singularity. Within mere hours, the ominous mud spreads, swiftly enveloping the planet.

The impact of the mud is both immediate and lethal; any human contact results in instantaneous absorption. Interestingly, the mud does not affect animals or plants, suggesting a selective hostility towards human life. By the end of the first day, over 90% of the world's human population has been eradicated. 

The survivors are few, managing to find refuge atop skyscrapers and other tall structures, the only places where the mud cannot reach. Thus, in less than a day, the once bustling planet is transformed into a desolate landscape of towering refuges amidst a sea of deadly mud.

objects.title: Matou Zouken
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt is relatively recent, in the year 2004 in Fuyuki City, similar to that of Singularity F. In this alternate timeline, the Greater Grail was corrupted by an Avenger-class servant. 

Don't let her appearance fool you, although she looks like a young girl, the entity that present themselves as the lostbelt king is a 500-year-old magus named Matou Zouken. This incarnation of Zouken inhabits the body of Matou Sakura, whose psyche shattered in a previous Holy Grail War, providing Zouken the perfect opportunity to assume full control. 

With Sakura’s potent affinity for Imaginary Techniques and a direct link to the Greater Grail, Zouken achieves both immortality and immense power. Within a few days, he completely subjugates the world’s military forces and the Magus Association, rendering them powerless.

Originally, Zouken’s ambition was to reach the Root, the source of all magic and knowledge. It remains unclear whether he has forgotten this goal over the centuries, or if his desires have been twisted by the corrupt Grail into something far more sinister. Now, he engages in grotesque experiments involving the inhabitants. This Lostbelt is infested with mana-absorbing insects known as crest worms. Each worm serves as an extension of Zouken, that he often use to gather mana from the residents and carry his disgusting experiments.

objects.title: Emiya Shirou
objects.text:
The divergence point of this Lostbelt traces to the 2004 Fuyuki Holy Grail War. The winner of this Holy Grail War was the master of Saber, A young man by the name of Shirou Emiya. Originally just a high school boy, he sacrifices a lot to uphold his flawed ideals, resulting in a Mind of Steel.

He wished upon the grail to be a hero of justice, and the Corrupted Grail made it possible by making Superpower emerges in the world. A lot of humans in this world posess what is known as "Innate Abilities," unique supernatural powers that vary from person to person. These abilities, quickly transformed society, leading to the rise of a new era where power dictated status and influence. 

Shirou's wish fundamentally altered the course of history, as the Grail’s response not only imbued people with abilities but also created a world where heroes and villains became a widespread concept. At the heart of this Lostbelt lies a towering monument known as "Avalon’s Flame," an eternal beacon said to house the will of Shirou Emiya. It is revered by some as a sacred shrine and denounced by others as a cursed relic. 

This Lostbelt’s King, a twisted reflection of Shirou Emiya, now known as "Hero of the End," reigns over the chaos with a contradictory resolve. Wielding a power that eclipses all others, he seeks to guide humanity toward a resolution—be it salvation or annihilation.

At first glance, this Lostbelt eerily mirrors proper human history, with one significant exception: Chaldea does not exist. Instead, its members are dispersed throughout the lostbelt, living ordinary lives. Familiar faces once thought lost to death, such as Olga Marie Animusphere and Romani Archaman, are inexplicably alive, their memories rewritten to fit this false reality. Yet, despite the idyllic façade, cracks begin to show. Subtle abnormalities plague the world: objects glitch momentarily before returning to normal, individuals sometimes vanish without explanation, and entire city layouts shift overnight—anomalies ignored or forgotten by the blissfully unaware inhabitants.

The truth of this Lostbelt lies with its King: Ritsuka Fujimaru. Or rather, a version of them who fell into despair during their harrowing journey to save humanity. Presumably when Mash Kyrielight was killed in the final Singularity. In their darkest moment, Beast IV appeared and bestowed its power upon Fujimaru. Thus, Ritsuka was reborn, not as a savior of humanity, but as a Beast of Humanity in their own right.

Empowered by their newfound Saint Graph, Ritsuka defeated Goetia in a climactic battle. However, instead of restoring Proper Human History, they used their newfound power to reshape the world itself. Their wish was heartbreakingly simple yet catastrophic: to create a reality where their greatest despair never occurred. The result was a world built upon fragile lies, where everyone they had ever loved or fought for could live peaceful lives, and where tragedy was an impossibility.

objects.title: Someone Else
objects.text: Choose some other Heroic Spirit to be The Lostbelt King (In the next Lostbelt King Section). The Heroic Spirit you chose need not to be King, they also could be the ruler of the most powerful country/faction or merely the person with the largest influence.

rows.title: Lostbelt King - Fantasy
rows.titleText:
Once your Lostbelt is stable, The Fantasy Tree will bound themselves to a powerful individual in the Lostbelt known as The Lostbelt King. Most Blessing and Power increase will go to them until the Lostbelt becomes the true history.

Who is the Losbelt King? It Must not be the same with your own servant

objects.title: Morgan Le Fay
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Fairies

This Lostbelt's true divergence point from Proper History was the absence of Excalibur, leaving Earth with no way to properly defend itself from Sefar. The fairies, originally tasked with forging the Holy Sword, shirked their duty, resulting in the annihilation of all life save for six fairies and a single human.

After their betrayal of the god Cernunnos, the fairies used its corpse to craft the sole surviving landmass: Britain, a hollow and cursed domain adrift in an endless ocean. Here, fairies dominate, perpetuating cycles of war and betrayal, while humans, cloned from the torn remnants of the last true human, are little more than livestock to fuel fairy pleasure.

Ruling over this shattered world is Morgan Le Fay, the Lostbelt King, who conquered the six fairy clans and imposed an iron-fisted rule for 2,000 years. A tyrant and protector, Morgan built an imitation of human civilization where fairies are cursed to pay an annual “existence tax” or perish, and humans are raised on ranches as property. Despite their fear and hatred of her, Morgan’s reign is the only force preventing the complete collapse of this fractured society. 

Beneath the surface, whispers speak of a Child of Prophecy, destined to overthrow Morgan and restore balance, though many question whether this world deserves salvation. This Lostbelt is a grotesque fairy tale, where joy is fleeting, suffering is eternal, and the very land pulses with the lingering sin of its creators.

objects.title: Uther
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Fairies

In this Lostbelt, history diverged 14,000 years ago when Excalibur was never forged. Without the Holy Sword, Earth succumbed to Sefar’s annihilation. The sin-stained fairies, exiled from the sacred sanctuary, betrayed their own god, Cernunnos, poisoning it and using its body to craft the island of Britain. Chaos and cruelty reigned unchecked for millennia, until Tonelico the savior arrives to the island.

Tonelico placed her hopes on humanity, secretly reshaping the timeline with stolen knowledge to crown a human king. Against all odds, Uther ascended the throne, surviving an attempted poisoning at his coronation through Tonelico’s intervention. Now, Uther rules as a symbol of order and hope, his frail humanity a stark contrast to the fairies cruelty. 

Though Tonelico was meant to return to Avalon after establishing Uther’s reign, endless assassination attempts and growing unrest among the fairy clans trapped her in a perpetual battle to protect her chosen king. Uther’s reign is both fragile and extraordinary. The humans, bred as livestock for centuries, cling to him as a symbol of freedom. The fairies, still fractured into malicious clans, pay lip service to Uther’s rule while scheming in the shadows. Calamities such as the Mors plague the land. Tonelico, once the fairy of salvation, now walks a path of despair, her dream of a peaceful kingdom fading as she remains bound to this corrupt world.

objects.title: Ibaraki Dōji
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Oni

Following their victory over the Human champions, the Oni, led by Shuten-douji and Ibaraki-douji, launched a campaign of conquest against the human domains of Japan. The Oni, once scattered and divided, united under a common cause: to create a world where strength ruled supreme and weakness was eradicated. This new Oni society thrived on the principles of chaos, competition, and survival of the fittest.

Ibaraki-douji, once a loyal follower of Shuten-douji, began her journey toward kingship in the chaos that followed the Oni victory. Shuten, though a charismatic leader, was ultimately too mercurial and hedonistic to maintain a stable rule. Her focus on pleasure and personal whims left the Oni unorganized and prone to infighting.

Recognizing the need for structure, Ibaraki took it upon herself to unify the Oni under a single banner. She challenged Shuten-douji to a duel, invoking the ancient Oni tradition of settling disputes through combat and after a fierce combat, Shuten, impressed by Ibaraki’s determination, yielded her position willingly, appointing her as the new leader of the Oni.

As the new ruler, Ibaraki sought to transform Oni society from a loose confederation of warbands into a cohesive empire. She created (loosely enforced) laws that emphasized competition and survival while also fostering creativity. Ibaraki believed that Oni could be more than brutish monsters. Under Ibaraki’s rule, humanity’s role was reduced to that of slaves, laborers, and livestock. Villages of humans were allowed to exist, but only under strict control, serving as a source of food, entertainment, and occasional breeding stock.

objects.title: Shuten Dōji
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Oni

This Lostbelt diverged from Proper Human History during the Heian period, a time rife with conflict between humans and supernatural beings. In Proper Human History, legendary warriors such as Minamoto no Raikou and her Four Heavenly Kings successfully subdued the Oni that terrorized Japan and drives them to exctinction.

In this timeline, Tsuna, a peerless warrior and staunch defender of humanity, was manipulated and seduced by an Oni. He turned against his comrades during the decisive battle at Mount Ooe, slaying Minamoto no Raikou and allowing Shuten-douji to triumph. With Raikou’s death, humanity’s greatest protector fell, and the balance of power shifted irreversibly.

After the Oni’s victory, the land descended into chaos. Shuten-douji, driven by her hedonistic and anarchic tendencies, established a realm that reflected her desires: a world of endless festivals, carnage, and revelry. Shuten declared herself Queen of the Oni, ruling from her palace atop Mount Sake-no-Yama, a massive mountain where rivers of wine flow and the air is thick with the scent of blood and flowers.

The Oni thrived in this chaotic world, but humanity suffered. The few humans who survived the Oni’s conquest were either enslaved or hunted for sport. Shuten saw humans as toys to be played with, and her court became a grotesque theater of cruelty, where humans were paraded as curiosities, performers, or sacrifices to entertain the Oni nobility.

objects.title: Kulkukan
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Deinos

In this Lostbelt, a small shift in cosmic events reshaped Earth's history. 250 million years earlier than in Proper Human History, a meteor carrying alien microorganisms empowered Earth's theropods, creating the Deinos—intelligent, dinosaurian beings who became the Prime Species. Their collective goodwill, "Malla," fused the supercontinent Pangea and shaped an underground sanctuary named Mictlan to shield life from the catastrophic arrival of ORT, the Ultimate One, 66 million years ago. ORT's impact devastated the planet's surface, leaving it eternally burning while Malla directed the Earth's energy to sustain an artificial underground sun.

The Deinos thrived underground through photosynthesis until Mictlan's sun expired 60 million years later. Forced into hibernation, they were awakened only after ORT's heart was used to replace the dead sun, thanks to Camazotz—a human-turned-god empowered by mass human sacrifice and Nature Spirits. The humans of Mictlan, the Ka'an Kingdom, had perished in their final stand against ORT, leaving only their architecture and Camazotz as the last remnants of their civilization. In the present, Mictlan's sun is nearing the end of its fuel, threatening the survival of the Deinos. 

The King of this Lostbelt is Kulkulkan, but unlike her Proper History counterpart, Kulkulkan wasn't just a god. She is a deity born from the deification of the artificial sun created by Malla, a sun powered by ORT's own heart. 

This connection to ORT grants Kukulkan immense power but also ties her existence intrinsically to the fragile balance of Mictlan. As a divine entity embodying the sun, Kukulkan is worshiped by the Deinos as a life-giving force, but her presence is both a blessing and a curse. The heart that sustains her also serves as the key to ORT's potential resurrection.

If you don't pick ORT from scenario, ORT will be permanently deactivated by some unknown force.

objects.title: Camazotz
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Human

In this Lostbelt, ORT's catastrophic reawakening never occurs, allowing humanity to flourish in the subterranean world of Mictlan. Following the extinction of Malla's artificial sun, the Deinos entered permanent hibernation, leaving their once-dominant civilization dormant beneath layers of ash and darkness. Humanity, forced to adapt to the pitch-black depths, developed a thriving, yet bizarre civilization under the rule of King Camazotz, their eternal protector and god-king.

Without sunlight, humans evolved to rely on bioluminescent plants, fungi, and creatures for light and sustenance. The vast caverns of Mictlan shimmer with faint, ethereal glows, casting the landscape into a surreal dreamscape of shadow and glimmer. This bioluminescent ecosystem fosters not only survival but a unique cultural identity, with humans worshipping the darkness as both a sanctuary and an eternal trial. The Ka'an Kingdom thrives on geothermal energy, mysterious glowing rivers, and technologies rooted in bioengineering.

Life in the Lostbelt revolves around the worship of the bioluminescent ecosystem and Camazotz himself. Art, technology, and even warfare incorporate glowing elements, creating a visually stunning yet haunting aesthetic. The human population has developed heightened senses and a deep connection to the natural energies of Mictlan, with myths and traditions celebrating their symbiosis with the darkness. Society is built around geothermal cities, connected by vast, luminescent tunnels and guarded by bioengineered guardians created from Deinos remains. Though Camazotz’s rule has sustained humanity for millions of years, the lack of a true sun leaves the Lostbelt in a precarious balance. The bioluminescent ecosystem is delicate, and any disruption could spell disaster. And though nobody aware of it, the threat of the Ultimate One never subsides.

If you don't pick ORT from scenario, ORT will be permanently deactivated by some unknown force.

objects.title: Kashin Kōji
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Robots & Androids

This Lostbelt diverged from Proper History during the Muromachi period when a massive meteor from the depths of space struck the Earth, releasing a deadly plague. The pathogen, ravaged the biosphere, wiping out nearly all organic life. The surviving humans faced extinction, driven to desperation as the sickness eroded their bodies and minds.

One figure rose above the chaos: Kashin Koji, a legendary puppeteer. Having already replaced much of her own body with mechanical puppets, she was immune to the plague. Her unparalleled skill with machinery allowed her to engineer a solution: humanity’s physical form would be discarded and replaced with mechanical vessels. This desperate measure gave rise to the Mechascape, a world where humanity lives eternally as sentient robots, their emotions and desires streamlined for efficiency. Organic life is seen as a relic of the past.

The Mechascape is a dazzlingly intricate world of clockwork cities, massive metal landscapes, and endless neon skies. Machines roam the land, serving the singular purpose of maintaining perfection. 

The atmosphere is sterile, free from organic decay, and devoid of natural sounds. Instead, the rhythmic hum of machinery fills the air. Flora and fauna are mechanical constructs, designed only to beautify the environment, without the randomness of natural life. The Lostbelt operates under a chilling mantra: "Emotion is error. Efficiency is perfection."

Kashin Koji is a towering figure of metallic elegance, with her original human features preserved only in a mechanical faceplate that conceals a glowing core—her "soul." Her body is entirely mechanical, a masterpiece of artifice blending delicate craftsmanship and ruthless efficiency.

Having ruled for centuries, Kashin Koji believes she saved humanity by transcending its weak, organic nature. To her, individuality, emotion, and mortality are flaws. She is not malicious, but utterly pragmatic, and believes the eradication of organic life is a necessary step for universal salvation.

objects.title: BB
objects.text:
Dominant Species: Artificial Intelligence

This Lostbelt diverged from Proper Human History in the early 1000 AD, sort of. In reality, the divergence point wasn't in the past but rather the future. 

In this future, an armada of Velber arrived to wipe human civilization, and in a desperate attempt to preserve the human race, the humans sent an AI to the past with the goal of accelerating human civilization, believing that rapid technological advancement would provide the means to fight back against the cosmic invaders. However, this strategy had an unintended consequence: the faster humanity advance, the sooner the Velber armada arrives on earth. 

During these loops to preserve humanity, the AI integrated the Saint Graph of BB from an alternate timeline, one where humanity managed to beat the reawakening Velber 02. This fusion, resulting in the entity known as BB∞, which became the Lostbelt King. 

After hundred of thousands of loops, BB∞ realized the tragic truth: her attempts to accelerate human civilization had only hastened the Velber armada arrival, and every cycle led to greater devastation. In a moment of profound sorrow, BB∞ decided to halt humanity’s progress entirely, putting a stop to their technological development. Instead, she devised a plan to preserve them in an eternal simulation—a paradise where they could live forever without the fear of cosmic destruction.

The simulation was created as a perfect, idyllic world, where every human consciousness was uploaded and digitally preserved, living out their lives in a dream free from war, pain, or the threat of a Cosmic Invader. Humanity’s physical forms were rendered dormant and buried deep beneath the Earth, isolated from all external signals to prevent detection by the Umbral Star. 

While this ensured humanity's survival, it also condemned them to an eternal dream, where they were forever locked in a false reality, unaware of the true nature of their existence. A world where they could never be harmed, but also never truly live again.

objects.title: Someone Else
objects.text: Choose some other Heroic Spirit to be The Lostbelt King (In the next Lostbelt King Section). In a Fantasy Lostbelt, the Lostbelt King would either have to be someone who are or at least possess the blood of the dominant species or a Divine Spirit/God in it's own right.

rows.title: Species
rows.titleText: Which Species exist on your Lostbelt?

objects.title: Human
objects.text:
The Prime Species of Pan-human history. The collective will of humanity is represented by Alaya, and it is at odds with the natural forces of the planet. 

Within all humans exists the "Power of the Beginning", the "Root", the original model, from which all human genes began.

objects.title: Antromorphs
objects.text:
Species that have anatomy close to that of normal humans but also exhibit features closer to that of animals. They can be caused because evolution of the specified animal or human adaptation caused by the environment. 

Although they have sentience and can have communication and interactions comparable to those of human, they often still retain their animal instincts (if they're an evolved animals) or develop them (if they start as human which gain their features).

objects.title: Fae
objects.text:
A race of beings acting as extensions of the Planet, considered the "sense of touch" of nature.

In Pan-Human History, With the coming of the Age of Man, the Fairies retreated to the Reverse Side of the World along with the other Phantasmal Species. As the Age of Gods took longer to disappear in the British Isles than in the rest of the world, Fairies there continued to interact with humans for longer.

objects.title: Robots
objects.text:
Artificial Intelligence which are products of Human's technological advancement. Since humans made them, their physical body are mostly modeled after human anatomy. 

Their mind can process things much faster and more efficiently than humans but will have trouble with something that demands creativity. Their physical bodies are often created using metal, making them much more durable.

objects.title: Giants
objects.text:
Humanoid Phantasmal Species which lived during the Age of Gods. Differing traits are attributed to Giants between mythologies, but the most common trait ascribed to them is that they are typically large in size.

Giants feature prominently in Norse mythology and were present in Scandinavia during its Age of Gods in the form of Frost Giant (Jotunn), Mountain Giant (Bergrisi) and Fire Giant (Muspel).

objects.title: Oni
objects.text:
Demi-Human Phantasmal Species and a type of Demon symbolized by inferno and scorching heat. They declined as human civilization advanced, and are now all but extinct in Pan-Human History.

Unlike humans, Oni usually do not band together, as living abominations, they are not limitated to their local ecosystem. Most of them are being solitary beings that lives on their own with their own set of rules.

objects.title: Lahmu
objects.text:
Demonic Beasts spawned as children of Tiamat to replace humanity. Laḫmu are birthed from Tiamat's body and her Chaos Tide, even able to manifest from just a detached piece of her flesh. Differing from other demonic beasts from Lostbelt or Singularity, they are beings that "do not exist within our world." They are designed to be the "perfect humans," the next generation of beings to take the planet from the old humanity. They reproduce asexually, lacking the male and female sexes.

Despite not having any need to prey upon other creatures, they attack humans fervently simply because their conclusion of "becoming more like humans" is that killing humans is fun.

objects.title: Deinos
objects.text:
The Prime Species of the South American Lostbelt. Although appearing to be evolved Dinosaurs, they are actually plant-animal hybrids made by the "Divine Filaments" of the meteor. In addition to their high intelligence said comparable to supercomputers, they possess dinosaur-like physical strength, chameleon-esque camouflage, thought-based communication, the ability to nullify physical shockwaves using biowaves which function similar to an electromagnetic armor. 

They are considered perfected intelligent life, a "mankind with no need for conflict", each Deinos being strong enough to not need to compete for resources. Deinos are considered at least part-Dragons.

objects.title: Demon God Pillar
objects.text:
Demon God Pillars start as King Solomon's familiar. Created using art for employing daemons, which would later be named Lemegeton or Goetia. Each has its own distinctive personality, but they are also a hive-mind coalesced into Beast I. The Demon Gods' pillars are massive in scale, their eyes alone are each multiple times the size of a regular human. 

The pillars are covered in a surface layer of human bodies. The pilled up bodies are mixed, from the young to the old, the ugly to the beautiful, each frozen with different expressions according to the moment they were absorbed. These piles of bodies are three meters deep, below which are the Pillar's actual muscles and blood vessels.

objects.title: Dragon
objects.text:
The pinnacle of Phantasmal Species. In PHH, They have been involved with mankind since before the Age of Gods, and left many legends in the field of Thaumaturgy due to having freely intermixed with humans in the past. Dragons are creatures that generate Magical Energy merely by breathing, their lungs acting as spiritual worlds.

Dragons and humans are generally incompatible with each other, but, while Dragons are creatures that devour humans by simply existing, conflicts between them are for the most part caused by humans taking action first in order to gain something. Those who attack humans first would generally be looked down upon. The Dragon of Albion was the last Pure-Blooded Dragon in the world.

objects.title: Divine Spirits
objects.text:
Divine Spirits are Gods that deteriorated as the Age of Gods came to a close. It is the classification for the highest rank of Nature Spirit. God's strength are influenced by the amount of people worshipping them, hence they've been reduced to normal Divine Spirits since the end of the Age of Gods.

Divine Spirits aren't truly "alive" in the same sense as a human. Humans only become spirits after death, but the gods were either all spirits to begin with, or they became solely spiritual beings after the Deterioration of the Gods and the rise of the Human Order.

Divine Spirits can't be a Dominant Species

objects.title: Gods
objects.text:
Gods were beings formed by the thoughts of Humans and born into the world without being influenced by the will of the people. They grow stronger the more people worship them, but have been reduced to normal Divine Spirits since the end of the Age of Gods.

Gods are split into two categories, those things that were already there that became Gods after becoming objects of worship and those that were reborn as Gods. Those that were already there include heavenly bodies like the sun and moon or natural phenomena like storms, earthquakes, thunder, and wind.Those that were reborn as Gods were close to human originally, but deviated from humanity through various factors to become objects of worship.

rows.title: Dominant Species - Fantasy
rows.titleText: Which Species are the dominant one in your lostbelt

objects.title: Human
objects.text:
The Prime Species of Pan-human history. The collective will of humanity is represented by Alaya, and it is at odds with the natural forces of the planet. 

Within all humans exists the "Power of the Beginning", the "Root", the original model, from which all human genes began.
