Those that were already there include heavenly bodies like the sun and moon or natural phenomena like storms, earthquakes, thunder, and wind.Those that were reborn as Gods were close to human originally, but deviated from humanity through various factors to become objects of worship.

rows.title: Lostbelt King
rows.titleText:
Once your Lostbelt is stable, The Fantasy Tree will bound themselves to a powerful individual in the Lostbelt known as The Lostbelt King. Most Blessing and Power increase will go to them until the Lostbelt becomes the true history.

Who is the Losbelt King? It Must not be the same with your own servant

objects.title: Other
objects.text: Choose some other unlisted Heroic Spirit to be The Lostbelt King. Must not be the same as your own Servant.

rows.title: Ruler Relation
rows.titleText: This section will determine how The Lostbelt King will behave to you.

objects.title: Bitter
objects.text: The Lostbelt King doesn't like your presence. They're less likely to hear you out but wouldn't actively be hostile unless provoked.

objects.title: Friendly
objects.text: The Lostbelt King behaves friendly to you and respects you as his equal. They'll be more likely to hear you over and approve any of your requests.

objects.title: Indifferent
objects.text: The Lostbelt King doesn't think either way about you. He/She will treat you just like he/she treats anyone else in the Lostbelt. This is the default option.

objects.title: Hostile
objects.text: The Lostbelt King feel threatened by your presence and seek to eliminate you at all cost.

objects.title: Romantic Affection
objects.text: The Lostbelt King have developed a romantic feeling for you. This will positively impact their decision to help you.

objects.title: Slave
objects.text: The Lostbelt King believes that you are his/her slave. While this would allow you to meet them as soon as possible, it's extremely unlikely that they will ever hear you out.

objects.title: Your Servant
objects.text: Due to some unusual means, one of your chosen Servants becomes the Lostbelt King. Which indirectly puts you in charge.

rows.title: Location
rows.titleText: The region where your Lostbelt located at. This didn't determine the size of your Lostbelt, just where the tree of emptiness grow.

rows.title: World Modifier
rows.titleText: How is the world of your Lostbelt

objects.title: Peaceful
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt is naturally peaceful. They would choose to avoid conflict at all costs.

objects.title: Violent
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt is innately violent. They would seek to cause problems and pain to others, even if the situation prevents it.

objects.title: Loyal
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt is loyal to your Lostbelt King. They value their judgement and less likely to plot or rebel against them.

objects.title: Treacherous
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt is treacherous. When an opportunity strikes they will try to take down the Lostbelt King.

objects.title: Tolerant
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt treat everyone the same way, no matter which race/species you are. Note that this doesn't mean that they're gonna be peaceful.

objects.title: Racist
objects.text: The Population of your Lostbelt views some races/species as inferior. As a result, most of the inhabitants will discriminate against them. If they are also violent, this race will most likely be their main target

objects.title: Overflowing Resource
objects.text: The Lostbelt will have much more natural resources than proper human history. There will be less violence caused by the lack of resources

objects.title: Scarce Resource
objects.text: The Lostbelt have much fewer natural resource than proper human history. It'll be harsh to live in this Lostbelt and it will also be hard to keep the peace.

objects.title: Corrupt
objects.text: The Government is Corrupt, they will try to steal as much resource as they can while also making law that will benefit themselves with no regard to the populist

objects.title: Honest
objects.text: The Government is honest and Transparent. They won't be afraid to let what they're doing known to the public and will always do their best to uphold justice.

objects.title: Sad
objects.text: Inherently, the population of your Lostbelt are sad about how their lives turned out. They're gonna see everything from a bad perspective. It's gonna be really hard to satisfy them.

objects.title: Happy
objects.text: Inherently, The Population of your Lostbelt are happy. They'll live their lives to the fullest. They'll also tend to look on the bright side of things. It will be easier to please them.

objects.title: Slavery
objects.text: Slavery is still heavily practised in your Lostbelt. Human beings are commodities and can be bought/sold. If you're not careful you could also be captured by these slave traders and sold as a slave.

objects.title: Demon Beast I
objects.text: There are several Demon Beasts native to your Lostbelt. While usually moving in packs, they are pretty rare. The wilderness will still be relatively safe to traverse.

objects.title: Demon Beast II
objects.text: The Demon Beast are much bigger in number and also more powerful. Their attack on travellers will be a common occurrence. You'll need to prepare every time you go to the wilderness.

objects.title: Demon Beast III
objects.text: The Demon Beast are much more dangerous. Not only travellers, they will also attack cities & villages. The population would need to constantly watch for these beasts.

rows.title: Scenarios
rows.titleText: Scenarios that will happen in your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Rogue Servants
objects.text: Allow the summon of Rogue Servant. Rogue Servants are Servants without masters. Their purpose is to restore the human order. On their own, they are disorganized and small in number so they should be easy to take care of. However, should they find someone to rally on they will be a big problem.

objects.title: Rogue Servants II
objects.text: Rogue Servants are summoned much more frequently, The larger number allows them to organize and plan a coordinated attack to the Lostbelt. Even without a leader they're dangerous and should be swiftly dealt with.

objects.title: Rogue Servants: Grand
objects.text: Allow Grand Servants to be summoned as Rogue Servants. Unlike other servants, these servant are extremely powerful with power that can rival Beasts.

objects.title: High Priority
objects.text: The remaining member of Chaldea deemed your Lostbelt as a valuable target. They'll attack your Lostbelt sooner than later with everything they have left. You better be prepared before it happens.

objects.title: Lostbelt I
objects.text: By chance, the escaping member of Chaldea first arrives in your Lostbelt. Still confused, disorganized and inexperienced in dealing with Lostbelts they are at their weakest. However, the same thing can be said about you. Can you crush them once and for all?

objects.title: Low Priority
objects.text: The remaining member of Chaldea deemed your Lostbelt as a non-valuable target. They're unlikely to end up on your Lostbelt unless something forces them there. Hopefully other Crypter can eliminate them before that.

objects.title: A Star is Born
objects.text: There's a prophecy that says a chosen one would soon be born inside your Lostbelt. He/She are destined to take over it's control from the Lostbelt King. There's nothing you or the Lostbelt King can do to prevent them from being born or start their journey. However, once they've start their journey, you can choose how to react and maybe sway destiny to where you want it to.

objects.title: Rebellious Society
objects.text: Maybe the king is a tyrant, maybe they saw the downfall of your civilization, or maybe just because. Doesn't matter the reason, a rebellion is spawning inside your Lostbelt. They'll seek to overthrow whoever is in charge and install a ruler more to their liking for better or worse.

objects.title: Fake King
objects.text: The King of your Lostbelt isn't really the Lostbelt King. While they do run most stuff in your Lostbelt, the actual king is someone or something sealed within the Lostbelt. Regardless of who or what, They are much more malicious and will seek to destabilize your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Counter Guardian
objects.text: The world deemed your lostbelt as a threat to itself and has dispatched a special Heroic Spirit known as Counter Guardian to protect the balance. Unlike regular Servants, these Counter Guardians are backed by the world itself, providing them with a massive amount of magical energy and might ressurect them when they die.

objects.title: Holy Church Executor
objects.text: Due to something that went wrong in the creation of your Lostbelt, some Holy Church Executor from the original earth was also transported into your Lostbelt. While their original enemies are Vampires, they may also took some hostilities upon the existence of your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Other Masters
objects.text: You and Chaldea are not the only Master with Servant in the lostbelt. They wouldn't know of the situation beyond the access that the regular citizen of the Lostbelt have. Their existence and alignment is unknown to both you and Chaldea and they will pursue their own goal unrelated to but might intersect with your conflict.

objects.title: Holy Grail War
objects.text:
A Holy Grail War of some form is currently taking place within your Lostbelt. Not including you, in default there are 7 Master-Servant pairs participating in the war corresponding to the original seven classes of Saber, Archer, Lancer, Rider, Caster, Assassin and Berserker. 

You yourself are not a participant but might be dragged into the war. As usual, the winner of the war will be able to get a wish onto the grail.

objects.title: Master of The Moon
objects.text:
The nameless Master. An amnesiac student living in a school within SE.RA.PH until they was roped into the Moon's Holy Grail War and won them. This is them after they been placed as the ruler of the Moon Cell.

They will be summoned into your Lostbelt and due to similar ideals and shared relationships, they're much more likely to align themselves with Chaldea. Despite not being at the moon, their abilities would work perfectly within your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Calamity
objects.text: A Great Disaster was prophesied to strike your Lostbelt. Maybe the society had angered the gods, or some sinister creature is lurking below your Lostbelt. However, with enough preparation, it should be possible to repel when it happens.

objects.title: Calamity II
objects.text: The Disaster is something extremely powerful, mortals and normal heroic spirits would be powerless in its wake. You'll need a Divine Spirit or beings with similar/higher power to handle it.

objects.title: Calamity: Endgame
objects.text: The destruction of your Lostbelt is inevitable. All you can do is prolong it. You will literally need a miracle to even survive this level of calamity.

objects.title: Fairy King Oberon
objects.text: Spawn a Rogue Servant by the name Fairy King Oberon inside your Lostbelt. He's just a Rogue Servant without any special ability. He definitely won't cause Great Calamity to happen in your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Insect Eater
objects.text: Ah, this is normally BB thing, but by picking this I'll appear in your Lostbelt to trample all those disgusting imperfect humans ☆. Oh, of course that include you ♡. I ate all the Sakura Five already so don't expect me to be weak either.

objects.title: Another Beast
objects.text: Another Evil of Humanity lay dormant within your Lostbelt. They can be something that exist in the original world, or something native to your Lostbelt. They're asleep for now, but when they wake up they surely will shake your lostbelt to the core.

objects.title: The White Titan
objects.text:
Your Lostbelt is on top of the corpse of Sefar, an enemy beyond humanity and an extremely powerful being that long ago single-handedly put an end to the Age of Gods. 

The last time Earth encountered her, 80% of the planet’s surface was burned to ash. Her core, Heroic Spirit Altera will appear in your Lostbelt and attempt to revive her.

objects.title: Just-World Hypothesis
objects.text:
Instead of just something that will happen if Chaldea destroy your Fantasy Tree. Your Lostbelt is already marked by the human order as the one to be pruned. 

At a certain time, if you failed to fulfill it's request, the Corrective Filter of The Human Order will show up at your Lostbelt to prune your world in it's entirety.

objects.title: The Ultimate One
objects.text:
In your lostbelt lies the dormant extraterrestial being named the One Radiance Thing (ORT). This monster known as a being that killed all who approached it instantly. This being are shrouded in mystery and much stronger than The Alien God herself.

This version is weaker than it's PHH self and was heavily nerfed by having its Core separated from it's body (stored elsewhere in the Lostbelt) but don't take it lightly.

objects.title: Night Raid
objects.text: An elite group of Assassin had been sighted in your Lostbelt Capital. Several high-ranking officers had been assassinated by them. It is unknown if they are rebels, mercenaries from other nations or something else entirely. What matters is the fact that they are very skilled and extremely dangerous, each of them are as powerful as a Servant.

objects.title: Zombie Virus
objects.text: A Strange strain of virus has been recorded at a region in your Lostbelt. This virus reportedly induces aggressive behaviour in the infected, it's even rumoured that it can raise the dead back to life and makes them their host. You'll need to act fast before it spreads into the entirety of your Lostbelt.

objects.title: Power Trouble
objects.text: Due to an unexplained cosmic event, A Small Percentage of population in your Lostbelt gained Superpower. These superpower varies in shapes and form and had power level ranging from basic Magecraft to low-level Noble Phantasm

objects.title: Superpowered Zombies
objects.text: The strain of Zombie virus has mutated and allows a little bit of their host intelligence to seep through. This intelligence however is clouded by their hunger and only made them much more dangerous as the zombies can continue to use their host Superpower and abilities. If a Servant is infected by this strain their zombies too will be able to use their Noble Phantasm.

objects.title: Titans
objects.text: Several packs of gigantic humanoid monsters had been sighted in your Lostbelt. They are extremely hostile and will attempt to eat anyone getting close. They are extremely durable and only attacks aimed at their neck seem to hurt them, however, we can't be sure where exactly. They are fortunately mindless and only seen roaming the area they've spawned in. Unlike Zombies, they don't seem to infect their victims.

objects.title: Rumbling
objects.text:
Instead of Mindless Titans, We also sighted a massive amount of Colossally huge Titans moving from the sea. They are about 60 Meters in height and emmit extreme heat. Aside from those, there's also a large human-shaped head with a weird bone structure towering over them, it is persumed to be the head of the pack. 

They would reach your territory in approximately 1 Month. Plan carefully.

rows.title: Relationship Events (Prior)
rows.titleText: What did you do prior to the event of Grand Order. This will affect your relationship with the other player in your story. You can choose 3.

objects.title: Team A Get-Together
objects.text: Kirschtaria invited you to go to the Team A Get Together while wearing party glasses and fake mustache. Will you come?

objects.title: Ophelia Tea Party
objects.text: Ophelia and Pepe had invited you to join their tea Party in the cafeteria this night. Will you join them?

objects.title: Akuta's Study
objects.text: You saw Akuta in the library reading some books. She seems intent on summoning a specific servant, will you help her?

objects.title: Kadoc's Training
objects.text: Kadoc had been unhealthily reviewing the battle logs after he trained on the simulation with you. Will you study with him?

objects.title: Da Vinci Code
objects.text: Da Vinci held a trivia game tonight for the masters candidate. However the other members ofTeam A are seemingly busy with their things. Will you come?

objects.title: Doctor Roman
objects.text: You met Doctor Roman and Mash just as they were getting out from Mash room. He invited you to join them on a walk. Will you come?

objects.title: Meuniere Cake
objects.text: Meuniere seems very confused about a task that the new director gave him. He asked you for help with the promise you could get his portion of sweet for the week.

objects.title: The True Protagonist
objects.text: You met someone that you aren't familiar with. Apparently they're a master candidate recently scouted by Chaldea. They asked you for direction. Will you help them?

objects.title: Locked-Room Mystery
objects.text: Director Marisbury was found dead in his office. The exact cause is still a mystery. Will you help the investigators solve this murder mystery.

objects.title: The New Director
objects.text: The new Director, Olga Marie Animusphere seems overwhelmed by the task that Chaldea given to her. Will you offer her help.

objects.title: A "Nice" Priest
objects.text: A Priest by the name of Kotomine Kirei has visited Chaldea for some reason. Will you help him find his way around?

objects.title: Koyaan
objects.text: Chaldea has gotten some shipment from a Weapon company called the NFF and the Director were concerned with the quality. Will you help her test them?

rows.title: Faction
rows.titleText: Which Faction are you aligned to

objects.title: Crypter's Round Table
objects.text: You stay loyal to your Fellow Team A, the bond you made when you still in Chaldea still strong. You seek for other way to win without clashing each Lostbelts

objects.title: Eyes of The Apostle
objects.text: Despite being Crypter, your loyaltly lies within the Alien God that you might as well been the eight apostles. You reported each movement made by the Crypters and Chaldea to them.

objects.title: On Humanity Side
objects.text: You stayed loyal to the side of Human Order. When Chaldea arrive you wouldn't oppose them and may instead help them with their quest.

objects.title: Nobody but my own
objects.text: You are loyal to nobody. Not with the Crypter, Apostles or Chaldea and instead decides to do your own thing with your own rules.

rows.title: Crypters Relation
rows.titleText:
Formerly the A-Team of Chaldea handpicked by Marisbury Animusphere. The Crypters are your comrades, at least until each Lostbelts is stabilized. Each of the Crypters has been given their own Lostbelt to manage and although they function as a team, each of them has their own sets of goals and motivation.

By Default they'll have the same Lostbelt and Servants compared to the original, but if you took the place through this CYOA. They'll instead manage another Lostbelt that's similar in theme to their original Lostbelt. You also can change their Servant too if you want.

objects.title: Kadoc Zemlupus
objects.text:
Crypter of Russian Lostbelt and Master of Anastasia.

A silver-haired and slim young boy from Poland which joined Chaldea due to his capability to be a master. After he joined the A-Team, his pride feelings of inferiority became even stronger, as all his colleagues were first-class geniuses. 

Even so, he chose to whole-heartedly do his best to protect the Human Order, but his inferiority complex grew even larger after everything was rendered meaningless by Lev Lainur Flauros sabotage and being brought back by the Alien God.

objects.title: Ophelia Phamrsolone
objects.text:
Crypter of Scandinavian Lostbelt and Master of Sigurd

A girl who was born to the prominent Phamrsolone Magus Family in Germany, where her birth parents put her under immense pressure to become a first rate Magus through any means necessary. During her childhood her parents subjected her through several, incredibly painful magical operations in order to increase her overall abilities which left deep emotional trauma. Coupled with their magus mindset of obsessively pursuing the Truth, Ophelia did not receive much emotional support or love from them. As a result of this, Ophelia is incredibly shy and lacks self-confidence.

objects.title: Akuta Hinako
objects.text:
Crypter of Chinese Lostbelt and Master of Lanling Wang

A girl shrouded in mystery and no one really knows about. She seems to dislike people and avoid talking to them. She is someone who would be happy just reading books all day long in the shade. From Chaldea Report, she was a magus that's enrolled in the Clock Tower Botany faculty and later became a technician for Chaldea. 

She was then personally chosen by Director Marisbury Animusphere as a member of the A-Team after her talent was discovered. Due to unknown reason, she often avoids medical examinations conducted by Romani Archaman.

objects.title: Scandinavia Peperoncino
objects.text:
Crypter of Indian Lostbelt and Master of Ashvattman

Real name Arou Myourenji, He was a Japanese magus who practiced Shugendō; more specifically, tengu arts. It was a school of Shugendō that took corrupting into a tengu and finding one's way to hell as a premise. 

Changing his name to Scandinavia Peperoncino and becoming a freelancer, he was recruited to Chaldea after Marisbury Animusphere met Scandinavia during his travels.

objects.title: Kirschtaria Wodime
objects.text:
Leader of Team A, Crypter of Atlantis Lostbelt and Master of Caenis & Dioscuri

Kirschtaria Wodime was born into a thousand-year-old Magi lineage and is the head of the Wodime family. His father tried to have him assassinated sometime in his teens, that although unsuccessful, did end up permanently damaging his Magic Circuits. 

However, despite this normally crippling injury inflicted on him that would have destroyed most Magus's ability to perform Magecraft, Kirstcharia still retained his immense ability and latent talent in the art and was still deemed to be one of the best in the world.

objects.title: Beryl Gut
objects.text:
Crypter of British Lostbelt and Master of Morgan.

A mage from the Department of Botany at the Clock Tower. Although not renowned, he comes from an ancient family line. He was raised by his mother, a Witch, in the forest away from human civilization. During his childhood, he would learn magecraft specifically tailored for assassination, torture, and murder. 

Eventually, when his mother ran out of things to teach him, he killed her and went to the city, where he became both a serial killer and an assassin. He is infamous for being a criminal, and a murderer who kills just for fun.

objects.title: Daybit Sem Void
objects.text:
Crypter of American Lostbelt and Master of Tezcatlipoca

Daybit was a magus who once enrolled in the Clock Tower's Department of Lore, and while it was publicly rumored that he was expelled from the Department, he actually left voluntarily to join the Chaldea Security Organization. 

Rather than being invited by Marisbury Animusphere, he arrived of his own initiative upon hearing of Marisbury’s research and interest in his background. Although having belonged to the Department of Lore for 8 years, His records before joining them is non-existent.

rows.title: Novum Chaldea Relation
rows.titleText: The remnants of the Old Chaldea. Their goal is to solve the mystery of the bleaching of the earth and restore Pan-Human History to it's original state. They will try to destroy the Tree of Emptiness and collapse your Lostbelt.

rows.title: Apostles of the Alien God Relation
rows.titleText: Servants summoned by the Alien World for the purpose of enacting The Human Order Revision Phenomenon. Each of them are High Servant which have some divine spirits forced on their Saint Graph. Their loyalty lies for the Alien God although each of them have their own method and preference on completing their goal.

objects.title: Total Collapse
objects.text: The Stability of your Lostbelt is so low, that it Collapses, taking you with it before you're even able to escape.

objects.title: Consumed by The Tree
objects.text: You were to greedy and took too much from the Fantasy Tree. Its power began to corrupt your body and before you're able to do anything. Another Fantasy Tree is formed in your place.

objects.title: Cosmos Denial
objects.text: After a long and gruesome battle, Chaldea managed to destroy the Tree of Emptiness and erase your Lostbelt, effectively killing all of its Inhabitants.

objects.title: New History
objects.text: Chaldea was defeated and your Lostbelt managed to Stabilize. The Battle with the other surviving Lostbelts will soon commence and the winner will become the new history.

objects.title: On Dream's End
objects.text: A Calamity starting from your Lostbelt managed to find it's way to Proper Human History. It's now on it's way to cause the same thing that happened to your Lostbelt to the rest of the earth. Things can't be bleaker.

objects.title: Heroic Sacrifice
objects.text: You Sacrificed yourself to stop a Calamity from manifesting in Proper Human History. You entrust your goal to Chaldea and the last master of humanity as you take your last breath. Maybe the Throne of Heroes will recognize your heroic deeds and allow Chaldea to summon you as a Pseudo-Servant

objects.title: Redemption Arc
objects.text: After your Lostbelt collapsed, Novum Chaldea took you with them. With enough time, you managed to gain their trust, make a meaningful bonds with the new chaldea and become a backup for The Last Master of Humanity.

objects.title: Novum Chaldea
objects.text: After a long battle, you and Chaldea managed to find a common ground. You and the Lostbelt King allowed Chaldea to use the Lostbelt as a base operation while they fight the other Lostbelts and The Alien God.

objects.title: Refugee
objects.text: After your Lostbelt collapsed, you retreated to the other Lostbelt. While you're safe for now, whether this just a temporary sanctuary or if this Lostbelt will become the true history remains to be seen.

objects.title: Lostbelt Fusion
objects.text: After defeating Chaldea, you managed to strike a deal with some of the other Crypters to combine forces to fight the other Lostbelts and defeat the Alien God and their Apostles. Your story is still far from over.

objects.title: Apostle of Alien World
objects.text: You died along with your Lostbelt. However, the Alien World deemed you beneficial to them and revived you to serve their cause. You gain the abilities of your Servants along with some Divine Spirit Saint Graph that allow you to ascend to a High-Servant. Now as an Apostle of the Alien World, you'll soon clash with Chaldea once again.

objects.title: Capital of New Earth
objects.text: After beating Chaldea, The Alien God took a liking to your Lostbelt and decide to make them her permanent residence. She declared your Lostbelt the Capital of New Earth and declared her office there. With her and the apostles assistance, your victory in the upcoming war between Lostbelts is all but guaranteed.

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
